1073207543160291330.full_text: @Princelsars @kathypodgers The #NanjingMassacre was horrific, but not as horrific as the horrors under Mao including the Cultural Revolution

1073229288906862592.full_text: #NanjingMassacre is not well known in the UK. It was a horrific period of brutality on the Chinese citizens. It is one reason why Chinese /Japanese relations have their ups and downs !

1073201072485867520.full_text: 81 years ago today, the 13 Dec, was the start of the #NanjingMassacre. We were honoured to welcome guests from Nanjing University and the Nanjing Massacre Memorial Hall to Coventry this year to share lessons on how we can learn from such horrors to work for peace. https://t.co/GwjPlqSny4

1073230858180472833.full_text:
During this period, soldiers of the Imperial Japanese Army murdered Chinese civilians and disarmed combatants who numbered an estimated 40,000 to over 300,000 and perpetrated widespread rape and looting.

#NanjingMassacre

1073236162230120449.full_text: I devoutly hope that we will never again have to see such scenes as these. I think and hope, pray that humanity has learned more than we had learned up to that time.
